unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Significance Test: U.S. Versus China
question_text: A randomized experiment was performed to determine whether the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in the U.S.A. is different than the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in China. U.S.A. Manufactured Cars China Manufactured Cars Average $21.435$ $25.578$ Standard Deviation $6.635$ $7.413$ Number of cars $200$ $85$ Which of the following best describes the conclusion that can be drawn?

choices.text: There is evidence of a statistically significant difference in the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in the U.S.A. compared to the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in China since p < 0.01 p < 0.01 .

There is no evidence of a statistically significant difference in the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in the U.S.A. compared to the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in China since p < 0.01 p < 0.01 .

There is evidence of a statistically significant difference in the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured  in the U.S.A. compared to the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in China  since 0.01 < p < 0.05 0.01 < p < 0.05 .

There is no evidence of a statistically significant difference in the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured  in the U.S.A. compared to the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in China since 0.01 < p < 0.05 0.01 < p < 0.05 .

There is no evidence of a statistically significant difference in the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured  in the U.S.A. compared to the average miles per gallon of cars manufactured in China since p > 0.05 p > 0.05 .
